productRequirementsDocument.title: PRD for Fitness api updated
productRequirementsDocument.executiveSummary: This project aims to develop a beginner-friendly fitness mobile application targeting users aged 25-45 who feel intimidated by existing fitness apps. The MVP will focus on simplified workout tracking with pre-made plans, AI-powered nutrition logging via photos, and private progress sharing. The app will be built on a React Native and Node.js stack, leveraging a freemium business model to drive user acquisition and monetization.

inScope.item: Exercise demonstrations using images/GIFs or linked videos.
Meal photo tracking with AI analysis.
Progress visualization and tracking (e.g., photos, weight).
Basic private social sharing features with trusted friends.
Integration with Apple Health and Google Fit.

outOfScope.item: Hosting video content directly; using external links for MVP.
Public social features, community forums, or leaderboards.
Manual calorie counting and detailed micronutrient tracking.
Integrations beyond Apple Health and Google Fit (e.g., Strava, Garmin).
Live personal training or coaching features.

businessGoals.goal: Acquire 50,000 active users within the first 6 months post-launch.
Maintain a 30-day user retention rate of 40%.

useCase.title: Beginner Onboarding and Personalized Profile Setup
useCase.description: New users complete a simplified onboarding process that creates a personalized fitness profile without overwhelming them with complex options, following the trend of simplified user experiences for fitness beginners.

mainFlow.step: User opens the app and sees a welcoming, non-intimidating splash screen
User completes a brief fitness assessment (current activity level, goals, available equipment)
User selects primary fitness goals from beginner-friendly options (e.g., 'Build basic strength', 'Improve cardiovascular health')
User grants permissions for Apple Health/Google Fit integration
User sets up basic notification preferences
System creates a personalized dashboard with recommended starting plan
User is guided through a quick tutorial of core features

flow.step: System uses default beginner settings to create the profile.
System proceeds with onboarding, and the user can enable integration later in settings.

useCase.title: Workout Plan Selection and Guided Execution
useCase.description: Users browse and select from curated beginner workout plans, then follow guided sessions with exercise demonstrations using images/GIFs to avoid video hosting costs while maintaining quality instruction.

mainFlow.step: User navigates to the 'Workout Plans' section
System displays filtered recommendations based on user's goals and equipment
User browses plans with clear difficulty indicators and time commitments
User selects a plan and views detailed overview including exercises and schedule
User starts a workout session
System displays current exercise with image/GIF demonstration and simple instructions
User logs sets, reps, or duration for each exercise
System provides encouragement and form tips between exercises
User completes workout and receives summary and achievement notification

flow.step: User creates a custom workout by selecting individual exercises from the library.

flow.trigger: User wants to modify a plan
flow.step: User modifies an existing plan by swapping exercises for alternatives.
User pauses workout and the system saves progress for resuming later.

useCase.title: AI-Powered Nutrition Tracking via Photo Capture
useCase.description: Users capture photos of meals which are analyzed by third-party AI API to estimate nutritional content, providing a low-friction alternative to manual calorie counting that addresses the saturated nutrition tracking market.

mainFlow.step: User taps 'Log Meal' button on nutrition dashboard
User selects 'Take Photo' option
User captures photo of their meal
System uploads photo to third-party AI service (e.g., Google Cloud Vision API)
AI returns estimated food items and nutritional information
User reviews and confirms or adjusts the AI analysis
User can add portion size if needed
System logs meal to daily nutrition summary
User sees updated daily nutrition dashboard with visual indicators

flow.step: AI fails to identify food items and user manually enters the meal details.
User uploads a photo from their gallery instead of taking a new one.
User skips logging and can return to the nutrition dashboard to log later.

useCase.title: Progress Visualization and Goal Achievement
useCase.description: Users view comprehensive progress dashboards showing workout consistency, strength improvements, and body composition changes through simple, motivating visualizations that celebrate small wins.

mainFlow.step: User navigates to 'Progress' section
System displays dashboard with multiple progress widgets
User views workout consistency calendar showing completed sessions
User taps on strength widget to see progression on key exercises
User views body measurement trends (weight, photos if uploaded)
System celebrates milestones and achievements with badges
User can adjust goals based on current progress
System provides personalized insights and recommendations

flow.step: User exports progress data for sharing with a trainer or personal records.
User compares current progress to previous time periods.
User adds custom measurements to track beyond the defaults.

useCase.title: Private Progress Sharing with Trusted Friends
useCase.description: Users selectively share their progress and achievements with a small, trusted group of friends, providing social motivation without the complexity and moderation overhead of public social features.

mainFlow.step: User navigates to 'Sharing' section
User selects 'Share Progress' option
User chooses specific achievements or milestones to share
User selects which friends to share with from their trusted list
User adds optional message of encouragement
System sends notification to selected friends
Friends can view shared progress and send reactions/encouragement
User receives notifications of friend responses

flow.step: User declines to share and keeps progress private.
User adjusts sharing preferences for future automatic sharing.

flow.trigger: User wants to modify friend list
flow.step: User removes friends from their sharing list.

useCase.title: Health Ecosystem Data Synchronization
useCase.description: The app seamlessly synchronizes workout and health data with Apple Health and Google Fit, meeting user expectations for integrated health tracking while leveraging existing ecosystem investments.

mainFlow.step: User completes a workout in the app
System automatically syncs workout data to connected health apps
User views workout in Apple Health/Google Fit dashboard
System imports steps, weight, and other metrics from health apps
Imported data is used to enhance progress tracking and recommendations
User can manage integration preferences in settings
System handles conflicts and data resolution transparently

flow.step: User revokes access for specific data types in the app settings.
Sync fails and system queues data for later retry.
User manually triggers a sync operation from the settings screen.

nonFunctionalRequirements.requirement: All user health and personal data must be encrypted at rest and in transit, and the app must comply with GDPR and CCPA regulations to ensure user privacy and data protection.
The AI-powered nutrition analysis must return results to the user within 5 seconds for 95% of photo submissions to ensure a smooth and engaging user experience.
